intro: Guamia mariannae, commonly known as the Marianas hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Northern Mariana Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Guamia mariannae plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
